titleStmt.title: A machine-readable dictionary of Egyptian Arabic
titleStmt.author: Karlheinz Moerth
Tarek Eltayeb

sourceDesc.p: This is an original digital text.

list.item:
Initial glottal stop:
Only ʔ derived from q No ʔ within sentences cf. ʔinti ʔaṣl-an minēn? --> inti aṣl-an minēn?
Treatment of collectives: lemma is the collective form, cf. baʔaṛ
article is used with dash: il-, ik-, etc.
Plural the whole word, not only ending

monogr.title: An Introduction to Egyptian Colloquial Arabic
Grammatik des arabischen Vulgärdialektes von Aegypten
A Comprehensive Study of Egyptian Arabic. Volume Four. Lexicon Part

imprint.publisher: Center for Near Eastern and North African Studies

revisionDesc.change: 2814 records 2801 lemma records 7 mwu records 1 example records
3581 records 2920 lemma records 80 mwu records 439 example records
Added Woidich, Ahlan wa Sahlan vocabs from Word. All in all 1636 items; added 936, checked the rest.
add notebook evaluation of the library

sense.usg: respectful form of address to a man or a woman
höfliche Anrede an einen Mann oder eine Frau

sense.def: second month of the Coptic year; October - November
sesame past with roasted egg-plant
Sesampaste mit gebratener Aubergine
form of address
a sweet dessert made of semolina, butter, sugar and rosewater
Süßigkeit aus Gries, Butter, Zucker und Rosenwasser
an Egyptian card game
ein ägyptisches Kartenspiel
sweet dessert made of pastry, butter, sugar und nuts, covered with sirup or honey
Süßigkeit aus Blätterteig, Butter, Zucker, und Nüssen, die mit Sirup oder Honig übergossen wird

sense.usg: a formal adress for a man of rank
formelle Anrede für einen höhergestellten Herrn

sense.def: a type of egg-plant
is used for job titles
wird für Berufsbezeichnungen verwendet

sense.usg: wird dem Substantiv wie ein Adj. nachgestellt, ist aber unveränderlich

sense.def: a broth made from crumbled bread

cit.quote: to run away from one’s husband

sense.def: a type of buttery biscuits
eine Süßigkeit, die Vanillekipferln ähnlich ist

sense.usg: in reply to an order or a request
als Antwort auf Befehl oder Aufforderung

cit.quote: to add spicies or raisins and nuts
Gewürze oder Rosinen und Nüsse hinzufügen
thank God (lit. praise be to God)
Gott sei Dank (wrtl. Lobpreis sei Gott)
Hard work brings its own reward.

sense.def: district of Cairo, north of Giza
Stadtteil von Cairo, nördlich von Giza
town in Upper Egypt

cit.quote: to be so kind as to ...

sense.def: a district of central Cairo
a pastry made from fine noodles, soaked in syrup or honey
Süßigkeit aus Nudeln, Zucker, Honig, Mandeln und Nüssen gebacken

cit.quote: pertaining to the birth of Christ
not to be available any more

sense.def: a ritual bending of the torso in the Islamic prayer
the tenth month of the Muslim calendar

cit.quote: the wife of one’s hunsband’s brother

sense.def: a residential area in Cairo
Egypt’s fifth largest city
thin paste made of ground sesame seeds

sense.usg: used to add emphasis to questions
used with imperatives to express impatience
a polite way of addressing a woman

sense.def: particle used to introduce oaths
Schwurpartikel
a major souk of Cairo

cit.quote: to speak with a nasal voice

sense.usg: to attract the evil eye by talking about something

sense.note: Check Gisela: ist Quellen auch feminin?

sense.def: the southernmost of Egypt’s western oases
capital of South Sinai Governorate of Egypt

cit.quote: hair cut over the forehead in bangs
Wie bitte? Ich habe nicht verstanden.
The most important thing is the development of the country.
Ahmad studies at the the University of Cairo.
Ahmad ist immer noch im Krankenhaus.
aḥmad ʕandu talat tixwāt wilād (/ ṣubyān) wi-aṛbaʕ tixwāt banāt.
Ahmad has three brothers and four sisters.
Ahmad hat drei Brüder und vier Schwestern.
There is not more than that.
Mehr als das gibt es nicht.
Congratulations to you. (lit. usually said when somebody has got something new)
As for his friend, he is a doctor.
Was seinen Freund betrifft, so ist er Arzt.
I will not leave her here alone.
Ich werde sie hier nicht alleine lassen.
Instead of bread Ahmad brought milk.
bafakkaṛ abīʕ il-warša w-agaṛṛab ḥaẓẓi fi-t-tigāra.
I am thinking of selling the workshop to try my luck in commerce.
Ich denke darüber nach den Betrieb zu verkaufen
um mein Glück im Handel zu versuchen.
baḥiss innᴵ wikipidya bi-l-luġa l-maṣri ḥāga gamīla giddan.
I think that the Wikipedia in Egyptian language is a nice thing.
dass Wikipedia in ägyptischer Sprache eine schöne Sache ist.
His daughters work at the library.
She kissed the baby on its cheek.
He got scared when he saw him.
How many years have you lived here?.
I have been standing in front of the school for an hour.
Ich stehe schon eine Stunde vor der Schule.
We have been here for 8 years.
He sent me a registered letter.
Er schickte mir einen eingeschriebenen Brief.
We sent her to get the manager.
After school he started to work with us.
baʕdᴵ ma sāb il-gamʕa ʔibtada yištaġal fi l-wizāra.
After he left the university he started to work in the ministry.
The students’ hostel is in the city centre.
He would like to travel to Egypt.
The milk man is in the street.
She washes her face every day in the morning.
Sie wascht jeden morgen ihr Gesicht.
She walks exactly like her brother.
Sie geht genau wie ihr Bruder.
bitiʕmili ʔēh dilwaʔti, yā faṭma? – batfaṛṛag ʕa-t-tilifizyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Fatima, was tust du gerade? – Ich sehe fern.
He is looking for a grocery shop.
They are looking for a new flat.
He loves this thing very much.
Er liebt diese Sache über alle Maßen.
He is flogging a dead horse.
They are fishing in troubled waters.
He works in the passport office.
What does he work? - He is an engineer.
Was arbeitet er? - Er ist ein Ingenieur.
He toils to feed the children.
He visits us every other day.
Er besucht uns alle paar Tage.
Morgen geht es dir hoffentlich besser.
da ġalabāwi, yitkallim alfᴵ kilma fi d-diʔīʔa.
He is talkative, he speaks thousand words per minute.
I paid out of my pocket.
Ich habe das aus eigener Tasche bezahlt.
dafaʕtᴵ ʕala taṣlīḥ il-ʕaṛabiyya aktaṛ min tamanha.
I payed too much for the repair of the car.
Ich habe für die Reperatur des utos zuviel bezahlt.
dāymǝn binišrab šāy fi l-ʔahwa baʕda iš-šuġl.
We always drink tea at the cafe after work.
This is a very important matter.
Das ist eine sehr wichtige Angelegenheit.
di ʕaṛabiyyit mīn? – di l-ʕaṛabiyya btaʕitna. (hiyya) ṣġayyara bassᴵ kwayyisa.
Whose car is this? – This is our car. It’s small but it’s good.
Wessen Auto ist das? - Das ist unser Auto. Es ist klein

fs.f: Demonstr. f., Stat. constr. fem. Suffix 1Pl., gut, klein, aber

cit.quote: It is still an hour before he leaves, you can catch him.
He was extremely tired from all the work.
They expelled him from the school.
Sie warfen ihn aus der Schule.
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
fi faṣlina fīh tamantāšar ṭālib gidīd.
There are 18 new students in our class.
During the holidays, we went away for three days.
He kept walking in the street.
There is a nice garden around the house.
Um das Haus herum gibt es einen netten Garten.
He dragged his thin children along.
He forced her to eat more.
we have all been waiting for you.
Du bist spät gekommen. Wir haben alle auf dich gewartet.
I got these things from my sister.
gibtᴵ maʕāya ḥāga basīṭa miš ʔadd il-maʔām.
Eine Kleinigkeit. Ich hoffe es gefällt dir.

Wir werden mit Egypt Air fliegen.
Will you have time next Friday?
ḥattā law maṭṭarit zalaṭ hanzil atfaṛṛag ʕala l-matšᴵ barḍu.

ḥawilt afham biẓẓabṭᴵ ʔēh illi ḥaṣaḷ.

Um wieviel Uhr wird er ankommen?

haykūn fāḍi imta? - miš haykūn fāḍi abadan.
Will he have time tomorrow? - No, he will never be free.
Hat er morgen Zeit? - Er wird nie Zeit haben.
ḥēs kida sibīni afakkaṛ haniʕmil-ha izzāy.
As it is like this, let me think how we will do it.
I was exhausted from the journey.
He grew tired from all the work.
She does not want to go to town.
She is fearful for his reputation.
Sie sorgt sich um seinen guten Ruf.
She wants to get into the faculty of arts.
Where are they? - I don’t know.
Wo sind sie? - Ich weiß es nicht.
humma l-itnēn munsagimīn maʕa baʕḍ ʔawi.
The two really get along well with one another.
Die zwei verstehen sich sehr gut.
The two get along very well.
Die zwei verstehen sich sehr gut. (wie "Honig und Sesampaste")
They live on the first floor.
They live at the beginning of the street.
Sie wohnen am Anfang der Straße.
They live in the city centre.
Sie wohnen im Zentrum der Stadt.
He does not want to stop smoking.
He has caught a slight cold.
We gave the director some of the money.
iddi l-ʕēš li-xabbāzu wa-law yākul nuṣṣu.
Give the bread to its baker even though he eats half of it.
It is better to get an expert even though it costs more.
wenn er auch die Hälfte isst!
At noon the sun became hot for us.
Turn the air conditioner on because it is hot.
The hungry dreams of the bread market.
ig-ginēna di fīha ḥatta naxla gamīla.
There is even a beautiful palm tree in this garden.
In dem Garten ist sogar eine Palme.
The gnat alighted on the rose.
The house is on the left side.
il-biyāt iš-sitwi hiyya ḥāla yinxifiḍ fīha našāṭ il-ḥayawanāt.

He has got the fellow in his pocket.
Teuer zahlt sich am Ende aus.
Hard work brings its own reward.
il-ḥurūf il-kirīli bitustaxdam fi ʕiddit bilād urubbiyya.

Das kyrillische Alphabet wird in einigen europäischen Ländern verwendet.
il-kitāb da yištimil ʕala xamas tibwāb.
The book is on the table.
Das Buch liegt auf dem Tisch.
All I have belongs to you.
All good things come from God.

Der Lehrer schreibt mit einer Füllfeder.
The teacher is in the school.
Der Lehrer ist in der Schule.
il-muḥīṭ il-aṭlanṭi min muḥiṭāt il-ʕālam il-kibīra.
The Atlantic Ocean is one of the big oceans of the Earth.
Der atlantische Ozean ist einer der größten Ozeane auf der Welt.
il-ustāz aḥmad, ṛabbᴵna ʔanʕam ʕalēh bi-walad.
The soldiers opened fire on him.
il-ʕayyil ibtada yiʕayyaṭ lama ma-laʔāš ummū.
The child began to cry when he didn’t find his mother.
Das Kind begann zu weinen, als es seine Mutter nicht fand.
The children are loved by God.
The children made a hell of a row.
Today they feed the animals early.
Heute füttern sie die Tiere früh.
inta baʔa ḍamīrak miš biyinʔaḥ ʕalēk?
Don’t you have a guilty conscience?
You always make us feel ashamed.
Wo bist du auf die Welt gekommen?
Are you (m.) engaged? - No, not yet.
inta zaʕlān minni walla eh? - laʔ, abad-an.
Are you (f.) engaged? - No, not yet.
Bist du (f.) verlobt? - Nein, noch nicht.
Where are you from originally? From Aswan?
Woher bist du ursprünglich? Aus Assuan?
intu mabṣuṭīn hina fi maṣr. - ʔaywa, mabsuṭīn ʔawi.
Do you like it here in Cairo? - Yes, very much so.
Get off at the Tahrir Square!
The man is not able to manage his son.
Der Mann wird nicht mit seinem Sohn fertig.
iskindiriyya fi ṣ-ṣēf wiḥša ʔawi ʔawi.
It is good to be patient.
Kaffee ohne Zucker für die Herren.
Borrowing is a loss and paying back is a loss.
is-sana lli fātit kān ʕandina mašākil kitīr.
Last year we had many problems.
iš-šanṭa di lāzim titḥaṭṭᴵ fi r-raffᴵ fōʔ.

kammil iš-šuġlᴵ da f-baḥrᴵ talat sinīn.

kān fīh nās kitīr ʔawī fi l-maktaba.

kān ʕāwiz yiṭaffišni ʕašān yixla bīha.

kattaṛ xērak / xērik! - xērak / xērik sābiʔ.
kitīr minnina biyšūf ir-rusūm illi mawgūda ʕala l-gudrān ... il-fannᴵ da maʕrūf bi-sm il-grafīti.

kullᴵ sana w-inta ṭayyib wi-ʕuʔbāl mīt sana!

law miš mawgudīn fi l-bēt ḥayibʔū fi bēt aḥmad.

law samaḥtu, kuntᴵ ʕayza aʕṛaf il-ḥagāt di nuṭʔaha zzāy. law ḥaddᴵ ʕārif yiktib-li bi-t-taškīl.

l-awlād šāfu šaḥḥāt waṛa l-bēt bitaʕna.

lāzim aʕṛaf ʔēh illi ḥaṣal luhum.

lāzim niṭlaʕ mašy ʕalašān il-aṣanṣēr ʕaṭlān.

lāzim tāxud bālak aktar fi l-mustaʔbal.

Du musst pünktlich um sechs Uhr kommen.
